summary:
Blood pressure is the force of blood pushing against the walls of your blood vessels. It's measured in two numbers: systolic (when your heart beats) and diastolic (when your heart rests). A normal reading is around 120/80 mmHg.

Doctors use a tool called a sphygmomanometer to measure it. They might use a stethoscope to listen to your pulse or a digital machine that senses blood flow.

High blood pressure, or hypertension, can cause serious problems like strokes and heart disease. Low blood pressure, or hypotension, can also be an issue.
title: Blood pressure
